content.description: Stand start on small slab below the overhaning right leaning dihedral with left hand on a sideup and right hand on right-leaning, sloping rail. Climb the sloping rail to a crimp out right, then work your way into the dihedral and straight up. The line hasn't been climbed in years. Bring your brush. This is an absolutely phenomenal line. It inherits its name from the odd, Arabic/mystic grafitti inside the cave.
Stand start on the right side of the boulder, with right hand in high slopey crimp, and left hand on bad gaston, move up and left, ending by following the small finger crack to the top.
content.location: from the seance boulder, project is around the corner to the right

content.description: stand start below the vertical slopey crack with left hand on sloper, and right hand on lower crimp.  Follow the crack up and to the right until you find yourself on two slopey crimps 4 feet below the lip. from here pull a big lock off move to gain the top of the boulder!
content.protection: even landing, but because of the height 3 pads are recommended
content.location: about 75 ft downhill from the seance boulder

content.description: This area is home to the Seance, a Parkway testpiece.
